title: Anil Kumble
summary: Anil Kumble is a former Indian cricketer and a former captain of Tests and ODIs, who played Tests and ODIs for 18 years.

value.label: Anil Kumble
Bengaluru, India
Jumbo
Indian
Leg-spin bowler

image.altText: Image of Rashtreeya Vidyalaya College of Engineering

value.label: Kumble is a right-arm leg spinner (legbreak googly) with an unorthodox style, most famous for his flipper and a right-hand batsman He started his career as a fast bowler,which gave him a useful faster delivery. His unique bowling style can be attributed to matting pitches in Bangalore which assist top-spin and over-spin.

image.altText: Style of play for Anil Kumble

value.label: Kumble made his first-class debut for Karnataka against Hyderabad on 30 November 1989, taking 4 wickets.
The Ranji Trophy is a domestic first-class cricket championship played in India between teams representing regional and state cricket associations.

value.label: Kumble made his One Day International debut against Sri Lanka at Sharjah in the Austral-Asia Cup in 1990.

The Sri Lanka national cricket team, nicknamed The Lions, represents Sri Lanka in international cricket. It is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One-Day International (ODI) and T20 International (T20I) status.

image.altText: Image of Sri Lanka national cricket team

value.label: Kumble was selected in the Indian side for the 1996 World Cup and was the leading wicket-taker in the tournament.

The 1996 Cricket World Cup, also called the Wills World Cup 1996 after its official sponsors, ITC's Wills brand, was the sixth Cricket World Cup. It was the second World Cup to be hosted by Pakistan and India, and for the first time by Sri Lanka.
After the 2007 World Cup, he announced his retirement from ODIs
Kumble agreed to honour his contract with the Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) after retirement and played for 3 years.
The Royal Challengers Bangalore are a franchise cricket team based in Bangalore, Karnataka, that plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL).
Kumble is the second player to have taken all 10 wickets in a single innings of a test match.

image.altText: Kumble is the second player to have taken all 10 wickets in a single innings of a test match.

value.label: Kumble holds the record for the most wickets in a calendar year by an Indian in ODIs with 61 wickets in 1996

image.altText: Kumble holds the record for the most wickets in a calendar year by an Indian in ODIs with 61 wickets in 1996

value.label: Kumble holds the record of bowling 40850 balls in entire Test career, highest for an Indian.

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team

value.label: The Royal Challengers Bangalore are a franchise cricket team based in Bangalore, Karnataka, that plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL).
Domestic Ranji trophy cricket team based in the state of Karnataka
Arjuna Awards are given by the Government for outstanding achievement in sports
Padma Shri is the fourth highest civilian award in the Republic of India
The ICC Cricket Hall of Fame recognises the achievements of the cricketing legends.
